trans-unit.source: Setting and Retrieving Properties and Metadata for Blob Resources
trans-unit.target: Setting and Retrieving Properties and Metadata for Blob Resources

trans-unit.source: Containers and blobs support custom metadata, represented as HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: Containers and blobs support custom metadata, represented as HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: Metadata headers can be set on a request that creates a new container or blob resource, or on a request that explicitly creates a property on an existing resource.
trans-unit.target: Metadata headers can be set on a request that creates a new container or blob resource, or on a request that explicitly creates a property on an existing resource.

trans-unit.source: This topic contains the following subtopics:
trans-unit.target: This topic contains the following subtopics:

trans-unit.source: Metadata Header Format
trans-unit.target: Metadata Header Format

trans-unit.source: Operations on Metadata
trans-unit.target: Operations on Metadata

trans-unit.source: Standard HTTP Properties for Containers and Blobs
trans-unit.target: Standard HTTP Properties for Containers and Blobs

trans-unit.source: Metadata Header Format
trans-unit.target: Metadata Header Format

trans-unit.source: Metadata headers are name/value pairs.
trans-unit.target: Metadata headers are name/value pairs.

trans-unit.source: The format for the header is:
trans-unit.target: The format for the header is:

trans-unit.source: Beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for <externalLink><linkText>C# identifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa664670(VS.71).aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for <externalLink><linkText>C# identifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa664670(VS.71).aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Names are case-insensitive.
trans-unit.target: Names are case-insensitive.

trans-unit.source: Note that metadata names preserve the case with which they were created, but are case-insensitive when set or read.
trans-unit.target: Note that metadata names preserve the case with which they were created, but are case-insensitive when set or read.

trans-unit.source: If two or more metadata headers with the same name are submitted for a resource, the Blob service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If two or more metadata headers with the same name are submitted for a resource, the Blob service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: The total size of the metadata, including both the name and value together, may not exceed 8 KB in size.
trans-unit.target: The total size of the metadata, including both the name and value together, may not exceed 8 KB in size.

trans-unit.source: Metadata name/value pairs are valid HTTP headers, and so they adhere to all restrictions governing HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: Metadata name/value pairs are valid HTTP headers, and so they adhere to all restrictions governing HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: Operations on Metadata
trans-unit.target: Operations on Metadata

trans-unit.source: Metadata on a blob or container resource can be retrieved or set directly, without returning or altering the content of the resource.
trans-unit.target: Metadata on a blob or container resource can be retrieved or set directly, without returning or altering the content of the resource.

trans-unit.source: Note that metadata values can only be read or written in full; partial updates are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Note that metadata values can only be read or written in full; partial updates are not supported.

trans-unit.source: Setting metadata on a resource overwrites any existing metadata values for that resource.
trans-unit.target: Setting metadata on a resource overwrites any existing metadata values for that resource.

trans-unit.source: Retrieving Properties and Metadata
trans-unit.target: Retrieving Properties and Metadata

trans-unit.source: The GET and HEAD operations both retrieve metadata headers for the specified container or blob.
trans-unit.target: The GET and HEAD operations both retrieve metadata headers for the specified container or blob.

trans-unit.source: These operations return headers only; they do not return a response body.
trans-unit.target: These operations return headers only; they do not return a response body.

trans-unit.target: The URI syntax for retrieving metadata headers on a blob is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Setting Metadata Headers
trans-unit.target: Setting Metadata Headers

trans-unit.source: The PUT operation sets metadata headers on the specified container or blob, overwriting any existing metadata on the resource.
trans-unit.target: The PUT operation sets metadata headers on the specified container or blob, overwriting any existing metadata on the resource.

trans-unit.source: Calling PUT without any headers on the request clears all existing metadata on the resource.
trans-unit.target: Calling PUT without any headers on the request clears all existing metadata on the resource.

trans-unit.source: The URI syntax for setting metadata headers on a container is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The URI syntax for setting metadata headers on a container is as follows:

trans-unit.target: The URI syntax for setting metadata headers on a blob is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Standard HTTP Properties for Containers and Blobs
trans-unit.target: Standard HTTP Properties for Containers and Blobs

trans-unit.source: Containers and blobs also support certain standard HTTP properties.
trans-unit.target: Containers and blobs also support certain standard HTTP properties.

trans-unit.source: Properties and metadata are both represented as standard HTTP headers; the difference between them is in the naming of the headers.
trans-unit.target: Properties and metadata are both represented as standard HTTP headers; the difference between them is in the naming of the headers.

trans-unit.source: Metadata headers are named with the header prefix <parameterReference>x-ms-meta-</parameterReference> and a custom name.
trans-unit.target: Metadata headers are named with the header prefix <parameterReference>x-ms-meta-</parameterReference> and a custom name.

trans-unit.source: Property headers use standard HTTP header names, as specified in the Header Field Definitions section 14 of the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=1762</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Property headers use standard HTTP header names, as specified in the Header Field Definitions section 14 of the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=1762</linkUri></externalLink>.
